title: Can anyone comment against 'an eye for an eye makes the world blind'? - Quora

response.answer_text: I tend to agree with Gandhi’s point. But if a tiresome debate were starting, it might be cooled by a lecture saying that ‘eye for an eye’, like some other Old Testament policies, was in context a softening of previous custom. Here the previous custom was escalation: an injury to an eye would start a clan war/feud with a lot more injuries to more people.
You could always ask the person who said it whether or not it is just and fair for people to commit crimes and atrocities and get away scot free.
It is completely true, without mercy/forgiveness we would be unable to progress, everybody has a something to take out on someone else and if everyone did it the world would spiral out of control
